intro: Cynanchum jailicola, commonly known as the Chinese milkweed vine, is a flowering plant native to China and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, milky-white flowers. The plant produces small, green fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
